titleproper.value: Guide to the Mary Agnes Brady Papers <num>MC 186</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-12-04T16:40:26</date>

extent.value: in 1 manuscript box and one oversize box

abstract.value: This collection comprises the personal papers of Mary Agnes Brady, graduate student in the School of Education, Health, Nursing, and the Arts Professions (now the Steinhardt School of Culture, Education and Human Development).  This collections contains class notes, papers, and assignments relating to theater history, theory, and performance.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Collection Name; MC 186; box number; folder number; New York University Archives

Mary Agnes Brady was a masters student in the School of Education, Health, Nursing, and the Arts Professions concentrating in theater.  She earned a Master of Arts degree in 1939. Prior to attending New York University, Brady received a Bachelor of Arts degree from Miami University in 1934.

This collection contains papers, play scripts, stage set designs, costume designs, scrapbooks and course notes by Mary Agnes Brady, a 1939 graduate of the School of Education.  Brady's class notes consist of the history, theory, and practice of theater.  The two scrapbooks in the collection contain images of costumes and set layouts designed by Brady as well as a script of Romeo and Juliet edited by her.

subject.value: New York University. School of Education, Health, Nursing, and Arts Profession.
